com.inamik.template
Class TemplateEngineConfig

java.lang.Object
  com.inamik.template.TemplateEngineConfig

public final class TemplateEngineConfig
extends java.lang.Object

TemplateEngineConfig - Configuration class for TemplateEngine.

This class is instantiated with acceptable defaults and can be used to create a TemplateEngine without any modification.

Created on Jul 9, 2006

Author:
Dave
See Also:
TemplateEngine, TemplateConfigUtil

Method Detail

setApplicationRoot

public void setApplicationRoot(java.lang.String applicationRoot)
setApplicationRoot - Set the application root folder.

By default, the application root is set to ".", or the current working directory. Use this method to set the application root to some other folder on the filesystem.

Parameters:
applicationRoot - The application root folder. null is permissable and is equivelent to "."
See Also:
DEFAULT_APPLICATION_ROOT, getApplicationRoot(), setTemplateRoot(String)

getApplicationRoot

public java.lang.String getApplicationRoot()
getApplicationRoot - Get the application root folder.

Returns:
The application root folder
See Also:
DEFAULT_APPLICATION_ROOT, setApplicationRoot(String)

setTemplateRoot

public void setTemplateRoot(java.lang.String root)
setTemplateRoot - Set the template root folder.

By default, the template root folder is set to the application root folder. Use this method to set the template root to some other folder on the filesystem.

If the specified folder is relative, it is considered to be relative to the application root folder.

Parameters:
root - The template root folder. null is okay and indicates that you want the template root folder to be the same as the application root folder.
See Also:
DEFAULT_TEMPLATE_ROOT, setApplicationRoot(String), getTemplateRoot()

getTemplateRoot

public java.lang.String getTemplateRoot()
getTemplateRoot - Get the template root folder.

The default template root is "/", which is treated as being whatever the application root folder is defined as.

Returns:
The template root folder.
See Also:
DEFAULT_TEMPLATE_ROOT, setTemplateRoot(String), setApplicationRoot(String)

setDebug

public void setDebug(boolean debug)
setDebug - Enable or disable debugging mode.

This is really only meant for the project developers and should probably not be used by normal users. This configures the template parser to generate a ton of ouput, usefull for tracking down parsing errors.

addUseLib

public void addUseLib(TemplateEngineConfig.UseLib useLib)
addUseLib - Add a reference to template library XML configuration.

This allows you to add a reference to a template library xml configuration that will be loaded and processed by the template engine during instance creation.

This is basically a hack to get around the fact that we don't know / haven't verified the application root while processing the template engine XML configuration and have to go back after we have an application root and load any libraries that use 'file =' to specify their location.

I would make this to be package-private, but template engine uses com.inamik.template.util.TemplateConfigUtil and I want that to stay in .util for now.

Parameters:
useLib - The library reference to add
See Also:
TemplateEngineConfig.UseLib, getUseLibs(), clearUseLibs()

getUseLibs

public TemplateEngineConfig.UseLib[] getUseLibs()
getUseLibs - Get the list of configured useLib's.

Returns:
An array of UseLib[]
See Also:
addUseLib(UseLib)
